name: Red Flag Detection
description: Recognizing early warning signs of narcissists and manipulators before they infiltrate your life.

cards.title: Recognizing Narcissistic Microbehaviors
cards.description: Identifying the subtle behaviors that reveal narcissistic tendencies before full manipulation begins.
bulletpoints: Inconsistencies in words vs. actions create a pattern of deception.
Love-bombing tactics overwhelm with excessive admiration to build control.
Passive-aggressive control emerges through backhanded compliments and subtle digs.
cards.summaryText: Watch for mismatched words and actions, love-bombing, and subtle digs to spot narcissists before they dig in.

cards.title: Gaslighting and Deceptive Language
cards.description: Learning to identify speech patterns and language tricks that narcissists use to distort reality.
bulletpoints: Word salad conversations confuse by overwhelming with nonsensical language.
Blame-shifting phrases redirect accountability onto the victim.
Contradictory narratives expose a pattern of deception and manipulation.
cards.summaryText: Flag the word salad, blame shifts, and contradictions so their deceptive language can’t fog your reality.

cards.title: Hidden Power Plays and Social Positioning
cards.description: Understanding how narcissists infiltrate social groups, workplaces, and relationships using covert influence.
bulletpoints: Triangulation tactics create unnecessary conflicts to divide and control.
False humility is used as a manipulation tool to lower defenses.
Social peacocking projects an exaggerated, curated image of success.
cards.summaryText: Notice triangulation, faux humility, and over-curated image plays—they’re early signs of covert power grabs.

cards.title: The ‘Too Good to Be True’ Illusion
cards.description: Identifying early-stage manipulative charm designed to disarm and ensnare victims.
bulletpoints: Rapid intimacy builds false emotional depth to create dependency.
Over-the-top compliments and exaggerated praise hide control intentions.
Unrealistic promises and grand future faking set up an eventual betrayal.
cards.summaryText: Question the too-fast intimacy, lavish praise, and future faking before you get hooked into the illusion.

cards.title: Subtle Disrespect and Boundary Testing
cards.description: Recognizing early violations of personal space, limits, and emotional autonomy.
bulletpoints: Playful insults and backhanded jokes normalize emotional abuse.
Boundary-pushing behavior gauges how much control can be exerted.
Ignoring ‘no’ or dismissing concerns signals a lack of respect for autonomy.
cards.summaryText: Treat playful insults, boundary pushes, and ignored ‘no’s as bright warning flares of disrespect.

cards.title: Creating Chaos and Drama Cycles
cards.description: Understanding how manipulators manufacture emotional turmoil to gain leverage.
bulletpoints: Manufactured crises keep attention focused on their needs and problems.
Emotional whiplash alternates between affection and cruelty to create instability.
Faked victimhood shifts blame and guilt onto others as a form of control.
cards.summaryText: See through manufactured crises, emotional whiplash, and faux victimhood before the chaos traps you.

cards.title: Excessive Secrecy and Hidden Agendas
cards.description: Spotting the signs of a manipulator’s double life and concealed motivations.
bulletpoints: Vague answers and evasive speech hide deeper deception.
Frequent contradictions reveal an ever-changing, false narrative.
Compartmentalized relationships prevent outsiders from seeing the full truth.
cards.summaryText: Track evasive answers, contradictions, and compartmentalized circles to expose the hidden agenda.

cards.title: Weaponized Insecurity and Projection
cards.description: Recognizing when manipulators reflect their own flaws onto others.
bulletpoints: Accusations of dishonesty often signal a liar projecting their own guilt.
Frequent comparisons diminish self-worth and increase dependency.
Shaming techniques weaken emotional resilience and enforce compliance.
cards.summaryText: Recognize projection, constant comparisons, and shaming—they weaponize your insecurity for control.

cards.title: Financial and Resource Exploitation
cards.description: Identifying financial red flags that indicate a narcissist’s self-serving motives.
bulletpoints: Early money discussions hint at financial dependency traps.
Refusing to reciprocate favors signals an entitlement mindset.
Sudden financial crises demand urgent assistance as a control tactic.
cards.summaryText: Spot the money talk, one-way favors, and sudden financial emergencies as resource-grab red flags.

cards.title: Identifying Hidden Covert Narcissists
cards.description: Spotting the warning signs of manipulative individuals who operate in stealth mode.
bulletpoints: Feigning victimhood diverts attention from their manipulative actions.
False humility is used to disguise a deeply rooted superiority complex.
Excessive self-sacrifice narratives generate unearned loyalty and obligation.
cards.summaryText: Identify covert narcissists by the martyr stories, fake humility, and constant victim posturing.
